body:
You can use this service if you need to apply for a child arrangements order in England and Wales.

(i) The process is different in [Scotland]({app:urls:url:court-process-scotland}) and [Northern Ireland]({app:urls:url:court-process-northern-ireland}).

It usually takes between 4 to 6 weeks after you apply to get a first hearing.

## Before you apply

You should check if you can resolve your dispute another way, for example through mediation.

There's usually a better outcome for children and parents if you can reach an agreement without going to court.

If you’re worried about the safety of you or your children you should continue with this application.

[Compare alternatives to court]({app:urls:url:cait})

### Attend a Mediation Information and Assessment Meeting (MIAM)

Before applying to court you must attend a [MIAM]({app:urls:url:professional-mediation}), unless [you're exempt]({app:urls:url:miams-exemptions}).

The MIAM will assess if mediation is right for you and whether you can agree arrangements out of court.

## Fees

It costs £215 to apply. Only the applicant (the person applying to court) needs to pay.

You may be able to [get help paying the fee]({app:urls:url:help-with-fees}) if you’re on a low income, receive certain benefits or have little or no savings. Apply online before you start if you think you're eligible.
heading: Apply for a child arrangements order
xlede: Make an application under section 8 of the Children Act 1989 for a child arrangements, prohibited steps, specific issue order or to vary or discharge or ask permission to make a section 8 order
